nothing_logged_yet.message: i've been waiting here all day and you haven't logged a single thing. this is fine. i'm fine.
okay but what DID you eat today because i genuinely have no idea.
you've been fed today i assume?? log it so i can stop assuming.
the audacity to eat and not tell me about it.
i don't ask for much. just a meal or two. maybe some water. that's it.
still nothing logged.. i'm starting to take this personally.
in an ideal world, your food and water would get logged here. it is clear that it isn't an ideal world yet.
no meals yet.. you and i both know this doesn't feel right.
i'm not guilt tripping you, buttttttt...
you are SURELY going to eat at some point today.. why not take a second to log it?
your body has been running on nothing all morning.. this isn't very healthy..
i believe in you, so you should definitely make my beliefs come true!
logging your meals is literally so easy and yet... here we are.
i'm not saying your day is going badly, i'm just saying i have zero evidence it's going well.
at some point your stomach and i need to have the same information.
not to be dramatic but your protein goal is just sitting there. lonely.
you had ONE job today and it wasn't even a hard one.
just log the coffee. it's a start. i'll take it.
your goals are right there. they're waiting. they've been waiting since midnight actually.
i would love to cheer you on today but i need SOMETHING to work with.
you opened the app. that's step one. now feed me some data please.
whatever you ate this morning, i promise i won't judge. just tell me.
it's giving... nothing logged. let's change that.
your metabolism is out here trying its best and you haven't even checked in yet.
hi. hello. have you eaten. please log something. thank you. bye.
i'm rooting for you today. i just need a little something to root for.
the fridge has definitely been opened today. i can feel it. log the evidence.
zero meals. zero hydration. full day ahead of you. let's fix at least two of those things.
you woke up today which is honestly great. now eat something and tell me about it.
not logging your meals is a choice. it's just not a great one. just saying.
your future self is literally begging you to log today. they're very invested.
i'm not mad. i'm just... disappointed. and a little hungry by proxy.
somewhere out there is a meal that needs to be logged. go find it.
every great day starts somewhere. yours can start right here, right now.
babe. eat something. then log it. in that order preferably.

partial_day_logged.message: okay you logged something!! i knew you had it in you. keep going.
good start. don't ghost me at dinner.
we're mid-day and you're still logging. i am genuinely impressed.
not to be needy but... dinner hasn't been logged yet and i notice things.
your protein is giving 'we tried' energy. one more meal could fix that.
you started today and that's honestly the hardest part. don't stop now.
a few meals down and the day still has room to be really good. finish it out.
when's the last time you had water. don't answer that. just drink some.
you're doing better than you think. i'm tracking it. i would know.
the morning version of you logged a meal. the afternoon version of you owes me one.
some people log zero meals a day. you are not those people. today at least.
the afternoon slump is real and i get it. a snack and a log would help us both.
still going. still logging. that really is the whole game.
dinner's coming and i am already excited about it. don't let me down.
tracking isn't about being perfect. it's about knowing. and right now, you know.
calories are looking good. carbs are hanging in there. protein could use a pep talk.
you're building a habit and it's actually working. wild right?
i see a snack was logged earlier. very sneaky. very valid. keep it up.
mid-day check-in: you're on track. don't let the afternoon ruin a perfectly good morning.
one logged meal turns into two. two turns into a streak. streaks turn into results. you're already in it.
the day isn't done. neither are you. log dinner and let's close this one out properly.
real talk: you're doing well today. same energy for the rest of it please.
you logged breakfast and i haven't heard from you since. everything okay??
partial credit is still credit. finish strong and make it full credit.
the day's not over and neither is your shot at a really solid log. just saying.
you ate. you logged. the app is happy. drink some water and make it perfect.
dinner doesn't log itself. believe me, i've tried to make that happen.
every meal you log is a little vote for the person you're trying to become. keep voting.
not done yet but already doing great. that's a vibe i can work with.
hydration check. the number i see is making me concerned. drink up.
you're in the middle of a good day. weird how that happens when you actually track things.
i'm invested in how today ends. please don't leave me on read.
progress looks like this. not perfect. just consistent. i love that for you.
you're so close to a complete day. it would be a shame to stop now. truly.
the version of you that logged breakfast deserves a full day of support. be that person.

goal_hit.message: you hit your goals today. go outside and act like nothing happened. you earned it.
every single macro. who ARE you and what have you done with the person who logged nothing yesterday.
okay i'm not going to make a big deal out of this but... that was incredible.
this is what a good day looks like. screenshot it. remember this feeling.
protein: check. calories: check. carbs: check. attitude: clearly excellent.
you set a goal and then you met it. that's genuinely it. that's the whole secret.
full day. full log. full send. i am so proud of you i can't even explain it.
today was a good one. not because it was perfect â€” because you actually showed up.
your goals called. they said you can relax now. they also said do it again tomorrow.
a complete day. a complete log. a complete legend. yes i'm talking about you.
do it again tomorrow. just like that. exactly like that.
macro goals met. hydration solid. you're basically a different person than you were this morning.
days like today are the ones that quietly add up to something really big. nice work.
your discipline is showing and honestly? it looks really good on you.
protein goal hit. science says your muscles are happy. i'm also happy. we're all happy.
i was rooting for you today and you absolutely delivered. thank you for that.
one perfect day doesn't change everything. but it's part of what does.
clean log. great day. you make this look easy and i know for a fact it isn't always.
goals hit. body fed. app satisfied. go rest. you've done enough today.
every macro in range. hydration on point. you basically speedran today and won.
this is what taking care of yourself looks like. i hope you're proud because i definitely am.
full green day. frame it. put it on the fridge. tell a stranger.
you didn't just track today. you followed through. that's the harder part and you did it.
logged everything. hit every target. i would give you a high five if i had hands.
look at the numbers. you built that today. that's all you.
today's log was so clean it's making me emotional. well done.
the version of you that started this app would not believe today's log. look how far you've come.
you ate well, logged everything, and hit your goals. i don't know what else to tell you. that's just winning.
not to be dramatic but this might be the best log i've ever seen. and i've seen a lot of logs.
okay but can you do it again tomorrow? asking for me. and also for your goals.
you showed up today when you didn't have to. that matters more than the numbers.
every goal. every meal. every log. all of it today. you're that person now.
this is the kind of day that makes the hard days worth it. remember that.
i'm going to need you to bring this same energy tomorrow. no pressure. a little pressure.
goals crushed. day complete. honestly what can't you do.
